title: Alabama sheriff's 'thugshot' Christmas tree draws complaints
description: A sheriff department in Alabama posted a doctored image of a Christmas tree adorned with mugshots.

title: Covid: William and Kate plan train tour to thank key workers
description: The duke and duchess will travel the UK to thank frontline staff for their work during the pandemic.

title: England seek to end year with second trophy - and revenge over France
description: England will attempt to round off 2020 by clinching the inaugural Autumn Nations Cup and taking revenge on an under-strength France at Twickenham.

title: 'Buddy the Elf' joke baffles dad in first meeting with son
description: Doug Henning confused his biological father after dressing as Buddy the Elf when they met last week.

title: Illingworth explosion: Three people taken to hospital
description: Firefighters were called to an explosion at a house in Green Lane in Illingworth, near Halifax.

title: England's Vunipola out of France game with calf problem
description: England prop Mako Vunipola is out of his side's Autumn Nations Cup final against France on Sunday with a calf problem.

title: Liverpool mayor Joe Anderson bailed in bribery inquiry
description: He was arrested with four other people in an investigation into the awarding of building contracts.

title: Australia and Argentina draw again as NZ win Tri-Nations
description: Australia miss a last-minute penalty as they draw 16-16 with Argentina in the final game of the 2020 Tri-Nations.

title: Covid: Russia begins vaccinations in Moscow
description: The home-grown Sputnik V vaccine, which is still undergoing mass testing, is being used.

title: Brexit stalemate: Boris Johnson and Ursula Von Der Leyen seek to break trade deal deadlock
description: EU and UK negotiators call in leaders in last ditch effort to secure a trade deal.

title: ICYMI: Covid street fight and near cat catastrophe
description: Our weekly video round-up, In Case You Missed It, looks at some stories that may have passed you by.

title: Why did the Netflix rival Quibi go so wrong?
description: The BBC speaks to three Quibi content creators on the rapid rise and fall of the Netflix rival.

title: South Africa v England: ODI series to start on Sunday after negative coronavirus tests
description: England's one-day international series against South Africa will begin on Sunday after the hosts' players tested negative for Covid-19.

title: Covid-19: Care home vaccinations to start 'within two weeks'
description: The medicines regulator says doses will have to be delivered to homes within 12 hours of unpacking.

title: The drag murder mystery show opening in a pandemic
description: Monet X Change and Courtney Act starred in a London show days after England's second lockdown ended.

title: Eric Dier: Tottenham defender on clean sheets, Jose Mourinho and creating his own app
description: Tottenham and England defender Eric Dier discusses being top of the league, working with Jose Mourinho and creating his own app.

title: Fans return: Dion Dublin revisits former club Cambridge United
description: Dion Dublin revisits former club Cambridge United to chat with manager Mark Bonner and players Paul Mullin and Joe Ironside, now that fans have returned to the Abbey Stadium.

title: Advent calendar: Day 5 - Curtis Jones’ screamer in FA Cup third-round derby
description: Day five of BBC Sport's 2020 advent calendar features 18-year-old Curtis Jones' spectacular winning goal for Liverpool against Everton in the 2019-20 FA Cup third round.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Le bust-up' as France 'derails Brexit talks'
description: The pause on the post-Brexit trade talks between the UK and EU dominates Saturday's front pages.

title: Where are England's coronavirus hotspots among older people?
description: Using the government's coronavirus data, where in England has the most cases among over-60s?

title: New Zealand's Stuff news group apologises for anti-Maori bias
description: After a deep dive into their reporting, Stuff found their coverage of Maori issues had been racist.

title: Coronavirus: Defiant ski nations bid to save winter season
description: Many of Europe's ski slopes will be closed, but the Swiss and Austrians have made their own plans.

title: Leg-lengthening: The people having surgery to be a bit taller
description: Hundreds of people are having long, often painful surgery to extend their legs. Is it worth the risk?

title: Christian Picciolini: The neo-Nazi who became an anti-Nazi
description: Christian Picciolini became a Nazi skinhead as a teenager but now he fights extremism.

title: Week in pictures: 28 November - 4 December 2020
description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

title: World's biggest iceberg captured by RAF cameras
description: A reconnaissance flight in the South Atlantic obtains spectacular imagery of the giant iceberg A68a.

title: Fighting air pollution: 'Without solidarity the world will be doomed'
description: Nineteen-year-old Abhiir Bhalla has campaigned against air pollution in Delhi most of his life.

title: Beirut explosion: The abandoned ship in the blast 'war zone'
description: This is what happened to Lebanon's only cruise ship, which was docked in the explosion's epicentre.

title: COVID-19: The students at school in a pandemic
description: Students in Hartlepool talk about what it's like going to school during a pandemic.

title: UK Snooker Championship 2020: Judd Trump beats Kyren Wilson in quarter-final - best shots
description: Watch Judd Trump's best shots as he turns on the style to beat Kyren Wilson 6-4 in their quarter-final a the UK Snooker Championship.

title: Joe Biden: Covid vaccination in US will not be mandatory
description: It comes as the Centers for Disease Control urges "universal mask use" anywhere outside the home.
